headline: Chicken Tetrazzini
description: Leftover chicken flavors this baked spaghetti casserole topped with Cheddar cheese.
name: Chicken Tetrazzini
recipeIngredient: 1 (10.75 ounce) can cream of chicken soup

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook spaghetti in the boiling water until cooked through but firm to the bite, about 12 minutes; drain. Transfer to a large bowl.

Melt margarine in a skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir onion in melted margarine until soft and translucent, 5 to 7 minutes; add to the spaghetti along with chicken, evaporated milk, cream of chicken soup, 4 ounces shredded Cheddar cheese, celery salt, salt, and black pepper. Toss mixture to evenly mix; transfer to prepared dish. Sprinkle 4 ounces shredded Cheddar cheese over spaghetti mixture.
Bake in preheated oven until cheese is melted and mixture is bubbling, about 45 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Loved it. I used 1 can of cream mushroom soup and 1 can cream of chicken. I sauted cubed chicken breast with onion ,butter,olive oil and dash of Italian seasoning. Combined all with short pre cooked under cooked spaghetti and cubes of chedder cheese. Topped with chredded Italian cheese . Oven 40 min. Whaaa laaa. mm. Thank you.
This was a delicious recipe. Used leftover shredded chicken.
Easy to make. Delicious! Shared recipe with my family!
Pretty bland. I think it needs more peppers and other additional extras
I followed the recipe exactly and it was awful. One scoop and we could not eat it.

This is great for a hectic evening. I am notorious for not following a recipe precisely. In this I used buttermilk instead of evaporated milk and a cheese blend (cheddar/jack). I also added mushrooms and peas. Everybody liked it, so yay!
I used egg noodles instead of spaghetti and it was great! Also, put oiled bread crumbs on top and it was delicious!
Love this recipe and come back to it often. Sometimes I add a can of Rotel tomatoes just to give it a kick.
Great dish. Very versatile and filling. I substituted rigatoni for the spaghetti, and it was delicious.
This is a fabulous dish! I only made a few changes... I sautéed zucchini and carrots with onions and garlic. My family couldn't get enough! I will make this again.
It was okay... but I over-cooked it a bit. 30 minutes in the oven would have been better than 40 minutes...

I boiled down the chicken let cool and shredded it. While cooking pasta noodles I mixed the soup, condensed milk, mushrooms, salt, pepper, celery salt and 4 oz shredded cheddar cheese all together. After realizing I didn’t have an onion I used a tablespoon of onion powder, I also added a teaspoon of garlic powder, I also put a cup of frozen peas in it. After mixing everything up it was sort of dry looking so I added a second can of cream of chicken soup and it seemed much better. I baked it for 30 minutes took it out stirred it put 4 oz mozzarella cheese on top sprinkled some grated Parmesan on top of mozzarella then sprinkled a little paprika to add a little color baked it an additional 15 minutes. Everyone in the household liked it and told me to save the recipe to fix it again.
Easy and just right
The recipe was really easy. It was a little dry though. Next time I’ll probably add another can of cream of chicken soup and more cheese. My family did enjoy it.

I agree with someone else’s post. It’s too bland. To spice it up, I added the Lipton onion soup mix to the French onion soup. Also, to keep things healthy, I’ve used brown rice and ground turkey versus beef and white rice as a variation in the past. I also think it taste better with cheese. When I think of French onion, I think of French onion soup, and provolone cheese on top is a nice addition.

Great recipe that is easy to modify with the ingredients you have on hand. I used cream of mushroom soup, egg noodle, and regular milk. I also took bread crumbs, melted butter and the cheese to make a crunchy topping. So good and easy!

While this tasted good, I agree it is a bit bland as written. I used turmeric spaghetti noodles which added some flavor, I think it would have been far too bland without it. Next time I'd add some more seasonings and maybe some veggies. Good starter recipe!

I omitted the salts since the cheese and soup had plenty. I also tossed the cooked chicken with a little garlic powder and celery salt to give the dish a little extra flavor. Oven time can be reduced a few minutes as the noodles were a little too soft even after cooking al dente. This was easy to throw together but even with the added seasonings it was lacking. Adding veggies would help give more flavor as well as a boost in nutrition.

My husband loved the Chicken Tetrazinni. I added fresh tomatoes and green onions as a garnish. I also added 1 tsp. of onion powder and 1 tsp. of garlic powder. I baked the casserole for 20 minutes. Next time I would add about a 1/2 cup of milk because we like our pasta saucy.
Really good dinner with leftovers. I used whole grain pasta and exchanged olive oil for the margarine because I’m trying to eat healthier, but was still really good.
After thanksgiving, we used our left over turkey to make this dish. What can I say, my family gobbled it up :-) it’s definitely a new favorite dish- going to try it again using rotisserie chicken
So easy and very good

This was great. My students loved it and so do I. The soup and evaporated milk prevent the sauce from being lumpy. I also discovered that I could make a wonderful, creamy, mac and cheese by using cheddar cheese soup and 4 ounces of cheddar jack cheese.

This is an awesome, easy, and quick recipe. It is pretty much foolproof, even for noob like me. I used rotisserie chicken for the chicken and seasoned to taste. I think next time (and there will definitely be a next time!) I will cover the dish for the first 30 minutes or so because the cheese on top got hard and dried out baking that long . Still tasted great!

For all the people who complain about a dish being "bland" on this recipe and others, it is kind of an unwritten rule that you are to adjust the seasoning of the dish to your taste. Recipes are written bland because it is easier to fix a bland dish than one that is too salty or spicy. The recipe gives you a general guide to the proportions and you are to adjust it to your liking. Use your own tastebuds as a guide.
My husband and I loved this recipe. I will definitely make it again.
This was a hit with my family, and the leftovers were great too. I made one small addition by adding about a cup of frozen peas to the spaghetti water.
So good!!! I had a package of Perdue Chicken Breast strips (roasted) (9 oz) in the freezer and it was exactly 3 cups cut up. It could not be an easier recipe to make!
It was so delicious I did not add onions because my son does not like onions.
I added mushrooms & bell peppers to mine. I also used blended cheese sharp cheddar, Colby jack & mild cheddar. It was really good & I have enough to last me for a couple of days.
I also added mushrooms and it was delicious

This was a little bland, although the kids and hubby liked it. I used ham instead of chicken, used rotini pasta, and added some corn, peas and cooked carrots for some color and to have veggies in the dish. I cooked some minced garlic with the onions and added oregano to the sauce . I used cream of chicken soup and a can of condensed milk as the recipe called for. I will likely make this again for the kids as they gobbled it down, but time I would try to figure out a way to add more flavor. The ham part was delicious, the rest was just meh.
My Mom got this recipe from a 1960's cookbook. She had crossed out all the vegetables. This is so good we will eat the leftovers straight from the frig.
It was very good. I added a can of cream of mushroom soup, and it was delicious.
Not the tet. I wanted....wasnt cheesy enough...idk what was wrong with it..very basic taste...
This is so good! The only thing I did differently was add more onion because I love onion. Definitely making this again!
I made this recipe with penne pasta. I also used half and half since I didn’t have evaporated milk. Wonderful recipe! It was a great way to use up the extra rotisserie chicken.

This is a great creamy dish. Perfect for family or taking to someone who is sick and needs something comforting. I made a second batch and added a drained can of Rotelle to spice it up for our family.

Easy and delicious! I used rotisserie chicken as a shortcut and it worked brilliantly! My very picky 9 year old gobbled it up. I left out the onions for her and it was still great. Next time we’re going to add bacon!
Very Good! Can't wait to try crab and shrimp, instead of chicken.

This dish got some great reviews from my teens! They declared that they like this better than regular spaghetti :) ....I tried this recipe as I was looking for a creative way to use a large amount of left-over spaghetti, and this worked excellently! Because the spaghetti was left-over, it was already covered in a light amount of marinara sauce; this turned out to blend with the other flavors very well. It did mean that I used cream of mushroom soup instead of cream of chicken, as I thought it would blend better. I also used garlic salt (instead of celery salt), again to blend well with the marinara flavor. I added extra cheese, using a full 2 cups inside, as well as the one cup on top, and covered everything in bread crumbs so I didn't get the burnt-cheese look from everyone's pictures. I will definitely keep this recipe on hand, and would recommend it to anyone who has a large amount of left-over pasta to use. (I really don't think that the shape would matter.) ADDENDUM: Tonight I tried this recipe slightly differently: The author suggested that the recipe could be used very well with left-over holiday turkey, and I would like to say that it is excellent this way! I made the recipe pretty much as written, just substituting the turkey, except that I still do like to use 2 cups of cheese inside! A topping idea for everyone: Again because I had some left-over from holiday meals, I decided to sprinkle French's Crispy Fried Onion Rings on top. (A half-can covers spar
Instead of celery salt I substituted garlic salt and added diced celery and sliced mushrooms

Use 2 cans of Cream of Chicken soup and add garlic powder and add more cheese to your liking.
This was a huge hit & my husband doesn't even like pasta!
Loved it and will make it again! This is a very easy and tasty recipe. I did add a little more onion for flavor. I froze half of it but won’t know about how it freezes for a while.
A little bland but overall was good. Added extra veggies.
Scrumptious!!!! Plates were cleaned so quick!!!

I gave this five stars because I believe that it would be wonderful as written. The changes I made for my taste: I sautéed sliced mushrooms and garlic with the onions in real butter. I also mixed in a little bit of sliced fresh spinach and oregano as well as mixing a little bit of breadcrumbs with the cheese on top before putting it in the oven. I doubled the recipe because I was cooking for a few more people. It was so tasty! I have made this recipe before with leftover turkey from Thanksgiving.
Excellent meal and sets up well.I ran out of evaporated milk and made my own by simmering 2 cups milk till reduced to half.

Fantastic. I tweaked this just a little and it's my favorite Tetrazzini that I've tried by far. While grilling the onion, grill a green bell pepper with it, also cut up a small tomato to add (to bake, not grill) and I used cream of mushroom instead of chicken. Perfect blend of flavors!

Recipe is easy to make and tastes good.
I made no adjustments except increased to 60 servings.

This was simple and good. I may have added too much pasta (my box was 8 oz and I tried to half it but may have added too much) since the juice disappeared after baking. Note to self: add less pasta next time!! This would be good with canned tuna as well.

I've made this several times. A really great go to recipe especially if you have leftover chicken
 I've made it & froze it too for a quick weeknight meal
Great recipe. Husband LOVED it. Added twice as many onions, but otherwise stuck to the recipe. Will make it again soon.

Had some left over chicken breast that were cooked in slow cooker over night on low with only some seasoned salt and butter. Found this recipe and followed as written. Very good. Great way to use up the leftovers. Will definitely make again.
I added about 3 cups of fresh spinach and a dozen medium sized mushrooms. Instead of cream of chicken, I used cream of mushroom. Next time, I will probably use penne.
I had leftover turkey noodle soup so I just added the evaporated milk, cream of chicken soup, and cheese for a great dish.

Overall it was very good. Ive made it both with ad without the chicken, and I found to add more flavour to pre season the chicken before it gets cooked to add extra flavour. I wish I coukd tell you what I used, but I never use the same seasoning twice.
Omg! What a keeper! I couldn't get enough! I loved the gooey cheese. I think next time I will use an idea from another review - oregano and garlic . Can't wait!

I made it but didn't use the celery salt or evaporated milk. I also used an extra can of cream of chicken and about 3 tsp of sour cream and black pepper. My kids loved it and so did my very picky husband! Ate this with a side of corn.

Made this tonight. Everyone loved it. Didn't have celery salt on hand. Added a little poultry seasoning to the mixture and topped the casserole with some French fried onions for the last ten minutes just because my family likes them as a casserole topping. No leftovers ..I did good ! Thank you for this recipe. I will definitely make again soon.
So good!!! Only thing I changed is that I didn't have evaporated milk so I used 1 cup whole milk & one half cup half & half mixed together. Ended up wonderful. My husband loved it too!
I've made this twice and it's been a hit both times. Did it with penne pasta and added garlic and oregano. Love the penne instead. Heartier!
Nice, but it did come out somewhat bland. I added fire roasted tomatoes, but I don't think it was the right flavor to add.
Almost done making this recipe when hubby said I don't really like chicken casseroles. TWO helpings later he changed his mind. YUMMY!!

Doubling the amount of pasta, I used 2 cans of cream of chicken. I threw in about 1/8 cup of dehydrated diced onions., 3 (12 oz) cans of chicken (Something left over from my "Emergency" supplies) , one can of Corn, one 12 oz package of Broccoli pepper and about 2 cups of cheese to mix with the dish. I cooked it for 30 minutes at 350. I pulled it out and topped it off with about 3 more cups of shredded cheese and baked it at 400 for about 15 minutes until the cheese got lightly browned. Most recipes are guides and starters for me, based on whatever is in the cabinet and freezer. If I don't have the ingredient, I usually just substitute or omit as it seems appropriate. One of these days I'll start using a measuring cup as well ;) This turned out well and will use it again :D

I made this dish for my fiancee and I, and it turned out great! I added mozzarella cheese in with the cheddar (in the mixture as well as the topping). I also sauteed my chicken, seasoned with garlic powder, onion powder, salt, pepper, and seasoned salt before I added it in with the mixture ( i also seasoned my mixture with the same seasonings to prevent blandness). And I baked it on 300 instead of 350. Other then that I stuck to the recipe exactly and it turned out great.
I love chicken so I added a layer of it on top then added the Cheddar. For a kick I sprinkled some paprika on top of the Cheddar. In the mix I did add sauteed mushrooms for Iron! yummy!
It was really good i liked it

This turned out great! I added fresh broccoli and garlic in with the onions and only used the cheese on top and even my Mom ( who is not a big fan of meat, including chicken) thought it was quite good.
I usually don't review recipes, although I love other people's reviews, but we loved this recipe so much. Made it exactly as the recipe said and was delicious. Served it with garlic bread and beans.

This was an easy dish to make. I did add 1 small can of mushrooms (drained) and 1 pkg of Lipton Onion Soup. Will keep this recipe handy. Since there are only 2 in the family, I halved the recipe and it worked great.
I have been making this for a few years. the kids just love it, well so do the adults. lo,l it is great
This recipe is simply easy and delicious!!! My husband and kids loved it. I added a side salad and garlic sticks.
So good. My family all loved it. Great leftovers too. Definitely a "make it again, dad!"

We found this to be good but bland. Chicken tetrazzini typically has mushrooms in it and I was tempted to put in some sliced fresh button mushrooms but wanted to stick close to the recipe at least the first time through. I'm not sure what else would perk up the taste of this but it was needing something. I halved the recipe and baked in a 9x9" pan for 30 minutes.

Liked this very much. Used two cans cream of chicken soup, and since I didn't have evaporated milk I used skim milk instead. Probably used more cheddar than the recipe called for, and topped it with bread crumbs as well. Initially I was afraid the spaghetti would get dried out, but was pleasantly surprised to serve an incredibly creamy, yummy and FILLING main dish. Talk about comfort food! This was very tasty and very creamy, but not sickening like an alfredo sauce. My husband and son liked it a lot as well. Good recipe, Mrs. Leonard!
